intro: Viburnum taiwanianum, commonly known as the Taiwan arrowwood, is a deciduous shrub native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that appear in spring. The plant produces bright red berries in the fall, which are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Viburnum taiwanianum typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden landscapes in temperate climates.
